TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit IPv6InterfaceProperties extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides information about network interfaces that support Internet Protocol version 6 (IPv6).

remarks.format:
## Remarks This class provides access to configuration and address information for network interfaces that support IPv6. You do not create instances of this class; they are returned by the <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.IPInterfaceProperties.GetIPv6Properties%2A> method.
For IPV4 properties, see <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.IPInterfaceProperties.GetIPv4Properties%2A>.
## Examples The following code example gets an <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.IPInterfaceProperties> object and displays its data.
[!code-cpp[NclNetInfo2#49](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CPP/networkexamples.cpp#49)] [!code-csharp[NclNetInfo2#49](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CS/networkexamples.cs#49)] [!code-vb[NclNetInfo2#49](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/VB/networkexamples.vb#49)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance int64 GetScopeId(valuetype System.Net.NetworkInformation.ScopeLevel scopeLevel) cil managed
abstract member GetScopeId : System.Net.NetworkInformation.ScopeLevel -> int64 override this.GetScopeId : System.Net.NetworkInformation.ScopeLevel -> int64

Docs.summary: Gets the scope ID of the network interface associated with an Internet Protocol version 6 (IPv6) address.
Docs.returns: The scope ID of the network interface associated with an IPv6 address.

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property Index As Integer
public: abstract property int Index { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the index of the network interface associated with an Internet Protocol version 6 (IPv6) address.
Docs.value: An value that contains the index of the network interface for IPv6 address.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the value of this property is zero, IPv6 is not supported by this interface.
## Examples The following code example gets an <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.IPv6InterfaceProperties> object and displays its data.
[!code-cpp[NclNetInfo2#49](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CPP/networkexamples.cpp#49)] [!code-csharp[NclNetInfo2#49](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CS/networkexamples.cs#49)] [!code-vb[NclNetInfo2#49](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/VB/networkexamples.vb#49)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property Mtu As Integer
public: abstract property int Mtu { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the maximum transmission unit (MTU) for this network interface.
Docs.value: An value that specifies the MTU.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The MTU of a network interface is the largest packet that can be transmitted. It is measured in octets (8-bit bytes).
## Examples The following code example gets an <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.IPv6InterfaceProperties> object and displays its data.
